29777.name: Land Use: Agricultural area - Area (FAO (2017))
29777.description: Land Use data include information for: Country area (including area under inland water bodies), Land area (excluding area under inland water bodies), Agricultural area, Arable land, Permanent crops, Arable land and Permanent crops, Permanent meadows and pastures, Inland water, Other land and Area equipped for irrigation. Data are available from 1961 onwards for more than 200 countries and territories. The FAOSTAT Land Use domain also contains data on Forest (Forest area and Carbon stock in living biomass) and forest types, which are derived from the FAO Global Forest Resource Assessments (FAO FRA). Additional land categories in the domain are: Temporary crops, Temporary meadows and pastures, Fallow land (temporary: less than 5 years), Permanent meadows and pastures cultivated and naturally growing as well as Organic land and Area of arable land and permanent crops under protective cover.

source.name: Land Use - FAO (2017)
source.dataPublishedBy: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) (2017)
source.dataPublisherSource: Primary sources of data are the Land Use and Irrigation questionnaires and forest data from the FAO FRA assessment. These official statistics may be complemented with official government data sources such as yearbooks and ministerial data portals.  Data gaps may be filled with secondary sources such as country studies from other International organizations, including use of geospatial data.  Data are flagged according to the type of data and the source.
source.additionalInfo:
: 
Land is the basis for most biological and human activities on Earth. Agriculture, forestry, industry, transport, housing and other services use land as a natural and/or an economic resource. Land Cover and Land Use data forms the basis for spatial and territorial analyses. Land can be divided into two interlinked concepts: a) land cover which refers to the bio-physical coverage of land (for example, crops, grass, broad-leaved forest, or built-up area); and b) land use which indicates the socioeconomic use of land (for example, agriculture, forestry, recreation or residential use). The FAOSTAT Land Use domain includes categories of land primarily focusing on their use for agricultural and forestry activities. Definitions of these items (land categories) are available at: http://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/RL. 

SEEA Compliance. The Input/Land Use domain is compliant with the System of Environmental-Economic Accounting for Agriculture Forestry and Fisheries (SEEA AFF), because: i) its definitions are included in the SEEA AFF, ii) it follows the FAO Land Use Classification; and iii) data can be directly used to compile the SEEA AFF Table 4.8, Physical asset account for land use, and SEEA Central Framework Table 5.15 Physical asset account for forest and other wooded land.
